titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Phyllis Walter Goodhart Gordan (d. 1994), was a graduate of Bryn Mawr College and Radcliffe. She was one of the founding members (1951) of the Friends of the Bryn Mawr College Library and a charter member of the Renaissance Society of America, which has an award named after her -- awarded yearly to the author of the best book in renaissance studies published in English. She was an avid collector of manuscripts and rare books, particularly of Renaissance editions of classical texts.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the scholarly papers of Phyllis Goodhart Gordan. Materials include handwritten and typed bibliographies and biographical notes on a number of important Renaissance figures. The collection also contains some translations and a concordance for Poggio Bracciolini's letters in various published and unpublished texts. Also included is a set of microfilms of excerpts from numerous Renaissance manuscripts relating to many humanist scholars and church matters. There are several articles and manuscripts by Gordan on Renaissance studies.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
